newsitem.title: HUNGARY: TVK sees further room for price rise.
newsitem.headline: TVK sees further room for price rise.

text.p: Hungarian chemicals company TVK Rt said on Wednesday the shares were still not expensive and saw further room to rise.
"I don't regard this price as realistic, I think the realistic price is between 3,500 and 4,000 forints, this year obviously," Sandor Palfi, TVK's Deputy General Director told Reuters.

On Wednesday TVK rallied to new record levels of 3,255 forints in Budapest and $17.75 in London, before retreating to lower levels. In Budapest, over 1.5 million shares or 6.5 percent of TVK's issued share capital changed hands.
Earlier on Wednesday Budapest and London traders said market talks of an imminent payout by the state due from the company's privatisation was the main driving force.
Palfi said he was confident TVK would get its five billion forints plus its accumulated interest but could not pinpoint the time it would happen.
"What we regard final and irrevocable is either to have a signed agreement with (privatisation agency) APV Rt or to have the money on our accounts," Palfi said. "None of these has occurred yet."
Palfi said he doubted that expectations of the privatisation payback were be the only reason behind the rise, saying the market has talked about this amount for a long-time.
"I would be surprised if this alone could trigger such a big change," he said. "Other factors have probably contributed as well."

Asked what the other factors might be Palfi said: "analysts, investors know TVK, they know on what the company's business mainly depends." "Now the market is favourable for us," Palfi added, referring to lower crude oil prices.
"Our main raw material, which account for more than 40 percent of total costs, derives from that (oil)."
Palfi added, that although he thought expectations of the privatisation payout have already been discounted in prices, the stock was still not expensive.
